subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_006C_01C9E033.B4BAE170
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

If you let him that is.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: April Aber=
crombie 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, May 29, 2009 8:00 A=
M
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.






  I think the botto=
m line is we all know that Chris Moon is probably just trying to use you. H=
e'll suck you dry and toss you aside when he gets his fill.

    ----- Orig=
inal Message ----- 
    From: Fransen, Debbie 
    To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.=
com 
    Sent: Friday, May 29, 2009 7:45 AM
    Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Diff=
erent chip config.



    Exactly my point... You don't charge anything for=
 the boxes
    and Chris Moon charges people for using it....
    If it's n=
ot perfected then Chris shouldn't charge either......
    If he wasn't so p=
ublic with it, then people like me wouldn't dislike him so much.

    The o=
nly people that have your boxes (that the public hear about)
    are the we=
ll known paranormal groups and famous people.
    I am sure that you have g=
iven boxes to researchers who are not in the popular
    paranormal communi=
ty ,and don't want to be. Those are the ones that should
    get respect.  =
And of course YOU are well respected by us lowly researchers. ( Kissin up ,=
 so you won't get mad)

    And I am sure that you are sick of hearing abou=
t Chris Moon and how
    alot of people thinks he sucks. And everyone wants=
 a box......
    But you have to expect that. You are the only one out ther=
e that is honest and
    doesn't want to be famous.
    I know this is like=
 beating a dead horse, so I will shut up now.... :)





------------------=
----------------------------------------------------------
    From: EVP-IT=
C@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Frank Sumpt=
ion
    Sent: Friday, May 29, 2009 9:22 AM
    To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
=
    Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.



     Keep in mind the =
money thing works two ways, I also don't sell/charge for the boxes. Someday=
 I will--when it's perfected!

     Frank-S


    On Fri, May 29, 2009 at 6=
:16 AM, Fransen, Debbie <debbie.fransen@...> wrote:





      Of cou=
rse Chris Moon speaks highly of him.
      Frank has made him lots of money=
.



----------------------------------------------------------------------=
----
      From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] O=
n Behalf Of Elaine Coates
      Sent: Thursday, May 28, 2009 3:49 PM 

    =
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com

      Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip =
config.




      Okay, then could I have a copy of the new schematic when =
you get it drawn?  That would be even better.  Where are you from?  Chris M=
oon speaks highly of you.




---------------------------------------------=
-----------------------------
      From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@g=
mail.com>
      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
      Sent: Thursday, May 28, 2=
009 2:29:09 PM
      Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.


      =
Besides--I didn't like that radio design, it's too complex, and the documen=
tation is screwy. I did a simpler radio last night that should be better, s=
impler, cheaper, and clearer sound. 



      On Thu, May 28, 2009 at 5:41 =
AM, Elaine Coates <cozykat2003@ yahoo.com> wrote:





        The jpg for =
this schematic is kind of blurry in places.  Is there any way a more clear =
copy could be send to me? I would be forever grateful.  Thanks Frank - Elai=
ne




--------------------------------------------------------------------=
----
        From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com>

        To:=
 EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
        Sent: Thursday, May 28, 2009 12:55:00 AM
=
        Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Different chip config.



        http://pur=
plealieng irl.tripod. com/ 

         However, it's constantly changing. Th=
e radio I made tonight is very simple, and can significantly simplify const=
ruction. I used to make the sweep and amplifier circuits, then use a commer=
cial radio, like the 12-469, as a tuner. 

         The MK484 is follwed by=
 a couple high impedence op amp stages to bring the audio up to line levels=
. I haven't had time to do schematic yet. I draw the schematics with MS pai=
nt, and they are stored as jpeg images, which isn't the best, but it makes =
them e-mailable. 

         Frank-S


        On Wed, May 27, 2009 at 8:54 =
PM, Elaine Coates <cozykat2003@ yahoo.com> wrote:





          Hi folks, =
I just joined this group.  I was recently at the Lizzy Borden house in Mass=
achusetts with Chris Moon and had a session with Frank's Box.  The results =
were astounding.  Is this the newest schematic for Frank's box?  If so, is =
there a way to get a clearer copy of it?  My son said he would build one fo=
r me and I have been searching for the schematic.  Can anyone help? - Elain=
e




---------------------------------------------------------------------=
-
          From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com>

          To=
: evp-itc@yahoogroups .com; grassharp@yahoogrou ps.com 

          Sent: We=
dnesday, May 27, 2009 5:45:16 PM
          Subject: [EVP-ITC] Different chi=
p config. [1 Attachment]




           I think I followed an erroneous LM3=
820 layout, so I'm going to breadboard this layout. Note the antenna input =
is now on pin 12-11, this is the RF amp input, and pin 13 is the RF amp out=
put, which feeds pin 1.

           'case anyone cares. 

           F-S


=
